item.description:
1) The tour is really interesting, and it's great to be able to experience a nationwide beer so close to home
2) Lots and lots of free beer. They have you sit at long tables when the tour is done, give you each a Sam Adams sample glass to keep, and pass down pitcher after pitcher of beer teaching you about how to be a beer connoisseur. Last time I went they passed out one that will never even go into production, but won some sort of contest - it tasted like circus peanuts!
3) If you're doing it right, you'll be 3 sheets to the wind by 1:00. And who knows where the rest of the day will take us with a start like that!
4) The tour is a requested donation of $2 only, and that $2 is located to local charities. Just make sure you bring along some singles for the donation!



Hit up the www.mbta.com trip planner for walking directions, but it's not too far from the Stony Brook T-Stop...
